Class Tetris

  • java.lang.Object
    • Tetris
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ArrowListener

    public class Tetris
extends java.lang.Object
implements ArrowListener
    The Tetris class implements a tetris game using a bounded grid as a board, a display, and Tetrads. It allows users to control falling tetrads to try and complete rows, clearing them as they are completed. The game keeps track of and displays the users score and level, and allows them to restart the game.
    Version:
    March 9 2019
    Author:
    Aditya Singhvi

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tetris

        public Tetris()
        Constructor for objects of class Tetris. Creates a new Tetris game, display, and automatically begins with a falling Tetrad.

    • Method Detail

      • downPressed

        public void downPressed()
        Called whenever the down arrow key is pressed. Translates the current active tetrad down by one block.
        Specified by:
        downPressed in interface ArrowListener

      • getLevel

        public int getLevel()
        Returns the level of the user. Found by dividing the total number of rows cleared so far by 10 and rounding down.
        Returns:
        The level of the user for the game.

      • getScore

        public int getScore()
        Returns the score of the user. The score increases every time a row is cleared.
        Returns:
        The score of the user for the game.

      • hasLost

        public boolean hasLost()
        Checks whether the game of Tetris has been lost yet and returns true if it has been lost, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the gamehas been lost false otherwise.

      • leftPressed

        public void leftPressed()
        Called whenever the left arrow key is pressed. Translates the current active tetrad left by one block, if possible.
        Specified by:
        leftPressed in interface ArrowListener

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method that creates a new Tetris game.
        Parameters:
        args - The arguments for the main method.

      • play

        public void play()
        Continues the game, moving the current active tetrad down by one block every set number of milliseconds (that is dependent on the level). If the tetrad has reached the bottom, clears all completed rows and creates a new active tetrad. If the game has been lost after the active tetrad has been placed, ensures that calling hasLost() returns true.

      • rightPressed

        public void rightPressed()
        Called whenever the right arrow key is pressed. Translates the current active tetrad right by one block, if possible.
        Specified by:
        rightPressed in interface ArrowListener

      • upPressed

        public void upPressed()
        Called whenever the up arrow key is pressed. Rotates the current active tetrad by 90Ëš clockwise.
        Specified by:
        upPressed in interface ArrowListener
